text: Chase-Coletta House, also known as the Lillie Ray Chase House, is a historic home located at Burnsville, Yancey County, North Carolina. It was built in 1914–1915, and is a 1 1/2-story, rectangular, Bungalow / American Craftsman style frame dwelling. It sits on a brick foundation and is sheathed in weatherboard. It features large gable dormers, a sleeping porch, and a hip roofed wraparound porch on brick piers. Also on the property is a contributing shed (c. 1925). It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2004. == References == Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1915 Category:Houses in Yancey County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Yancey County, North Carolina
title: Chase-Coletta House
